name: gitlab
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing GitLab resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`gitlab` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/gitlabhq/terraform-provider-gitlab).

baseUrl.description:
This is the target GitLab base API endpoint. Providing a value is a requirement when working with GitLab CE or GitLab
Enterprise e.g. `https://my.gitlab.server/api/v4/`. It is optional to provide this value and it can also be sourced from
the `GITLAB_BASE_URL` environment variable. The value must end with a slash.

cacertFile.description:
This is a file containing the ca cert to verify the gitlab instance. This is available for use when working with GitLab
CE or Gitlab Enterprise with a locally-issued or self-signed certificate chain.

clientCert.description: File path to client certificate when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data.

clientKey.description:
File path to client key when GitLab instance is behind company proxy. File must contain PEM encoded data. Required when
`client_cert` is set.

earlyAuthCheck.description:
(Experimental) By default the provider does a dummy request to get the current user in order to verify that the provider
configuration is correct and the GitLab API is reachable. Turn it off, to skip this check. This may be useful if the
GitLab instance does not yet exist and is created within the same terraform module. This is an experimental feature and
may change in the future. Please make sure to always keep backups of your state.

insecure.description: When set to true this disables SSL verification of the connection to the GitLab instance.

token.description:
The OAuth2 Token, Project, Group, Personal Access Token or CI Job Token used to connect to GitLab. The OAuth method is
used in this provider for authentication (using Bearer authorization token). See
https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/#authentication for details. It may be sourced from the `GITLAB_TOKEN` environment
variable.

accessLevelDescription.description: Readable description of level of access.

groupId.description: The ID of a GitLab group allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `user_id`.

userId.description: The ID of a GitLab user allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `group_id`.

accessLevelDescription.description: Readable description of level of access.

groupId.description: The ID of a GitLab group allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `user_id`.

userId.description: The ID of a GitLab user allowed to perform the relevant action. Mutually exclusive with `group_id`.

authorEmailRegex.description: All commit author emails must match this regex, e.g. `@my-company.com$`.

branchNameRegex.description: All branch names must match this regex, e.g. `(feature|hotfix)\/*`.

commitCommitterCheck.description: Users can only push commits to this repository that were committed with one of their own verified emails.

commitMessageNegativeRegex.description: No commit message is allowed to match this regex, for example `ssh\:\/\/`.

commitMessageRegex.description: All commit messages must match this regex, e.g. `Fixed \d+\..*`.

fileNameRegex.description: All commited filenames must not match this regex, e.g. `(jar|exe)$`.

memberCheck.description: Restrict commits by author (email) to existing GitLab users.

preventSecrets.description: GitLab will reject any files that are likely to contain secrets.

rejectUnsignedCommits.description: Reject commit when itâ€™s not signed through GPG.

accessLevel.description: Only return members with the desired access level. Acceptable values are: `guest`, `reporter`, `developer`, `maintainer`, `owner`.

statistics.description: Include project statistics. Cannot be used with `group_id`.

groupId.description: The ID of the group owned by the authenticated user to look projects for within. Cannot be used with `min_access_level`, `with_programming_language` or `statistics`.

externUid.description: Lookup users by external UID. (Requires administrator privileges)

provider.description:
The provider type for the gitlab package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

gitlab:index/projectApprovalRule:Project.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage multiple approval rules for your GitLab projects. For further information on approval rules, consult the [gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/merge_request_approvals.html#project-level-mr-approvals).

> This feature requires GitLab Premium.


## Import

# GitLab project approval rules can be imported using a key composed of `<project-id>:<rule-id>`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import gitlab:index/projectApprovalRule:ProjectApprovalRule example "12345:6"
```

gitlab:index/repositoryFile:RepositoryFi.description:
## Import

# A Repository File can be imported using an id made up of `<project-id>:<branch-name>:<file-path>`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import gitlab:index/repositoryFile:RepositoryFile this 1:main:foo/bar.txt
```

gitlab:index/getUser:getUser.description:
Provide details about a specific user in the gitlab provider. Especially the ability to lookup the id for linking to other resources.

> Some attributes might not be returned depending on if you're an admin or not. Please refer to [Gitlab documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/api/users.html#single-user) for more details.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

email.description: The public email address of the user. **Note**: before GitLab 14.8 the lookup was based on the users primary email address.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

avatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the user.

canCreateGroup.description: Whether the user can create groups.

canCreateProject.description: Whether the user can create projects.

createdAt.description: Date the user was created at.

isAdmin.description: Whether the user is an admin.

projectsLimit.description: Number of projects the user can create.

userProvider.description: The UID provider of the user.
